speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: SCENE I. Before Alexandria. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, AGRIPPA, and MECAENAS, with his Army; OCTAVIUS CAESAR reading a letter

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: He calls me boy; and chides, as he had power

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: To beat me out of Egypt; my messenger

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: He hath whipp'd with rods; dares me to personal combat,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Caesar to Antony: let the old ruffian know

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I have many other ways to die; meantime

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Laugh at his challenge.

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: Caesar must think,

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: When one so great begins to rage, he's hunted

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: Even to falling. Give him no breath, but now

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: Make boot of his distraction: never anger

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: Made good guard for itself.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Let our best heads

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Know, that to-morrow the last of many battles

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: We mean to fight: within our files there are,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Of those that served Mark Antony but late,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Enough to fetch him in. See it done:

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And feast the army; we have store to do't,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And they have earn'd the waste. Poor Antony!

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Exeunt
